page.title: 12Barnby Dun village
page.content: {Barnby Dun}is referred to in the Domesday Book as 'Barnebi'. In{Saxon times it is written of as the residence of Beorn. Plainly the 'on the Dun 'part was added to distinguish it from several other places in Yorkshire and Nottinghamshire called Barnby.At various other times it has been referred to as Barnby Dunne, Barnaby Dun,Barnby Donne and Barmby Dun.The Grove,Church Rd. and Madam Lane form the square around the church which marks the original{Saxon settlement.High St. is a later{Danish development with houses set at right angles to the road and strips of land behind.The oldest houses remaining in the village are{Bramwith cottage, {Blacksmith's cottage and forge, Poplar {Farm,Old Star Inn,Bridge store,Mill {House}and several small cottages on the High St.
